members.name: emptyAnchorFix
members.doc: For browsers that have editing issues with an empty anchor.

deprecated.text: It is set to false in every browser.

members.short_doc: For browsers that have editing issues with an empty anchor. ...

members.name: fakeAnchor
members.doc: Opera and WebKit do not make it possible to select empty anchors. Fake elements must be used for them.

deprecated.text: It is set to true in every browser.

members.short_doc: Opera and WebKit do not make it possible to select empty anchors. ...

members.name: synAnchorSelector
members.doc: For browsers that do not support CSS3 a[name]:empty(). Note that IE9 is included because of #7783.

deprecated.text: It is set to false in every browser.

members.short_doc: For browsers that do not support CSS3 a[name]:empty(). ...

members.name: getEditorAnchors
members.doc: Collects anchors available in the editor (i.e. used by the Link plugin). Note that the scope of search is different for inline (the "global" document) and classic (iframe-based) editors (the "inner" document).
members.short_doc: Collects anchors available in the editor (i.e. ...

members.name: getLinkAttributes
members.doc: Converts link data into an object which consists of attributes to be set (with their values) and an array of attributes to be removed. This method can be used to synthesise or to update any link element with the given data.

return.name: return
return.doc:
An object consisting of two keys, i.e.:

{
    // Attributes to be set.
    set: {
        href: 'http://foo.bar',
        target: 'bang'
    },
    // Attributes to be removed.
    removed: [
        'id', 'style'
    ]
}

members.short_doc:
Converts link data into an object which consists of attributes to be set
(with their values) and an array of attribut...

members.name: getSelectedLink
members.doc:
Get the surrounding link element of the current selection.

CKEDITOR.plugins.link.getSelectedLink( editor );

// The following selections will all return the link element.

<a href="#">li^nk</a>
<a href="#">[link]</a>
text[<a href="#">link]</a>
<a href="#">li[nk</a>]
[<b><a href="#">li]nk</a></b>]
[<a href="#"><b>li]nk</b></a>
members.short_doc: Get the surrounding link element of the current selection. ...

members.name: parseLinkAttributes
members.doc: Parses attributes of the link element and returns an object representing the current state (data) of the link. This data format is accepted e.g. by the Link dialog window and getLinkAttributes.
members.short_doc:
Parses attributes of the link element and returns an object representing
the current state (data) of the link. ...

members.name: tryRestoreFakeAnchor
members.doc: Returns an element representing a real anchor restored from a fake anchor.

return.name: return
return.doc: Restored anchor element or nothing if the passed element was not a fake anchor.

members.short_doc: Returns an element representing a real anchor restored from a fake anchor. ...
